metadata.metaValue: Offset along point normals / maintain angles
Calculate the length of the offset vector, so that the resulting edges are parallel to the sources. Thanks @ Hey UU for this code.

For each border point find 
- the two border edges 
- the two face normals that belong to those border edges
Interpret a property "extrude Depth" on faces, face/verticies or points

Interpret a property "extrude_depth" which can be a face_component, a face_vertex_component or a point_component.
If it is present then it will be multiplied by the input "extrude_depth".

If there is no such property and the input "extrude_depth" is an ARRAY then this array will be used as a "per-island" depth.

The property "extrude_depth" will then be set in the object and be used in the next step "do_depth".
array<float>, array<long>, array<uint>, array<bool>, array<string>, array<Math::float2>, array<Math::float3>, array<Math::float4>, array<Math::float3x3>, array<Math::float4x4>
array<float>, array<long>, array<uint>, array<bool>, array<string>, array<Math::float2>, array<Math::float3>, array<Math::float4>, array<Math::float3x3>, array<Math::float4x4>
Interpret an array input for "extrude Depth" as per-island-depth - only if there was no property "extrude Depth" present

"convert_property" will use the existing property "extrude_depth" and resample it to point/face-vertex values depending on the status of "keep_faces_together".
The user input "extrude_depth" is no longer needed here because it was already multiplied into the property.

This mixes (actually *switches*) between two methods of calculating the normal for the depth vector.
1. is simply the average point normal
2. calculates the angle to one neighbouring face normal to ensure that the resulting surfaces are parallel to the source faces -> adjacent/cos(angle)=hypotenuse
array<float>, array<long>, array<uint>, array<bool>, array<string>, array<Math::float2>, array<Math::float3>, array<Math::float4>, array<Math::float3x3>, array<Math::float4x4>
array<float>, array<long>, array<uint>, array<bool>, array<string>, array<Math::float2>, array<Math::float3>, array<Math::float4>, array<Math::float3x3>, array<Math::float4x4>
Fix the ordering after separating the extrude islands
Find the open edges on the source faces and on the new extrude faces

Build the two arrays "face_vertex" and "face_offset".
Build the face tags for those new side faces.

Source face mode:
0 = delete
1 = keep
2 = reverse
